job_title: Administrative Assistant in Little Rock, AR
pros: I work for a super great boss. It makes coming to work easy. I enjoy what I do and it's been a nice break from corporate life.
cons: The hiring process was awful. They gave me a start date, then didn't honor that date. I had already left my job, they didn't start me for three weeks after that. They also get really hung up on whether you have an higher education for pay, in today's world I really don't feel like that should be taken into account as much. In salary negotiations they argued with me multiple times that they would not come up because I didn't have a higher education but I have 10+ years in this field and multiple references to prove that I'm a dependable, knowledge, and coachable employee.

review_title: Wouldn’t go back for all the money in the world.
job_title: Linen Assistant/Equipment Technician in Little Rock, AR
pros: The only good thing I can say is that when I worked there it was for the children. There are some people that I do miss. But, after the crap I went through I wouldn’t return to work there.
cons: You would think it being “Children’s Hospital “ they would take better care of there employees as well as the children they treat. I worked in a service department which was under the hospital when I started in 2006. But, in 2014 the CEO thought it be a good idea to reorganize all departments which put us under EVS. Worse mistake ever, cause EVS was managed by a outside company. Once they took our department over. They played favorites, did what they could to terminate the employees they didn’t like. They made work and life very stressful and made the work harder than it really should. I was the lead in the department and had to step away from that role cause I wouldn’t play there dirty game of “lets get dirt on everyone “!  They also changed the policy of how many days allowed to a policy in which they would have another reason to fire good employees that are really in fact sick. But all this is just my opinion.

job_title: Insurance Specialist in Little Rock, AR
pros: Great Pay! Advancement! Growth! Family!
cons: None at this time with ACH

job_title: Registered Nurse in Springdale, AR
pros: Multiple opportunities for advancement, offers many forms of education, great benefits
cons: For some of the educational opportunities, travel to Little Rock is required

job_title: APRN in Benton, AR
pros: I love working with the pediatric population.
cons: Management has changed things negatively over the most recent years.

job_title: Security Specialist in Little Rock, AR
pros: ACH treats their employees with great respect and the pay is very competitive.  You receive annual increases as well as bonus'.  They like to have fun but know when to be serious.  They give you coupons from Honey Baked Ham that never expire (as long as your employed).  HBH comes to the hospital at various times to accommodate each shift.  Ice cream parties....!!! Christmas parties!!' Pictures with Santa (for the employees), ha!  But it's truly all about the kids...think about it, if they do that much for their employees, imagine what it's like for the kids!
cons: Some challenges you may face...everybody has an opinion.  I don't have anything negative to say about the 5yrs I was there.  Sure, I had my issues with certain things, and I hope some day those internal issues will be corrected but they were designated to my area of employment only, and had to do with a system created many years ago...I know they are always working to make things easier and user friendly.  ACH houses over 4000 employees so, you can't please everyone.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Little Rock, AR
pros: Nice, clean, friendly, safe, fun
cons: not really any cons that i can think of

review_title: kids are awesome, admin is less than impressive.
job_title: Patient Information Assistant in Little Rock, AR
pros: Great families. The patients make you want to come back every day. There are great benefits to working at ACH, reimbursement of tuition, insurance, employee assistance programs and fun activites. My personal director and upper level administrators are wonderful. They help in a pinch, are willing to listen to ideas and issues, and make the clinic a great place to work, but my clinic is the exception to the rule.
cons: The senior managment, nursing supervisors, vp's and above, at ACH are difficult to work with. They insulate themselves from any changes, and require the nurses and other team members bear the brunt of their decisions. Other unit and clinic directors are un-willing to help, and tend to lead from behind a desk. If you do have problems, the open door policy they claim is very threatening. They are not always clear in their expectations. Prepare to be on the defensive most of the time.

review_title: A Place of Care, Love and Hope
job_title: Desktop Support Specialist in Little Rock, AR
pros:
At Arkansas Children's Hospital you are able to see what Care, Love and Hope truly are.  The support staff, doctors, and outside people are all great to work with and for.  

ACH was voted in the top 100 companies to work for and after working for them in a full-time compacity, I can see why.  Management is fair with its decisions and are extremely generous and caring when it somes to employees and anything you need to feel more more comfortable in you position.

Policies and procedures are extremely fair and take the employees into consideration.  ACH truly is a place of care, love and hope.
cons: So far, the only thing I have noticed is some of the employees do not pull their own weight.

job_title: in Little Rock, AR
pros: The work itself. Helping work on children is rewarding. Have witnessed miracles. Watching children go from really sick to living their best life has been a wonderful experience.
cons: Poor departmental communication.  Nepotism and favoritism runs rampant. This has occurred in more than one department. Leadership is lacking and admin was aware and did nothing. The in house politics has gotten worse over the years.  I gave three stars because first half of career was good. Watching treatment to long term employees is sad and disappointing. Unfair promotions due to nepotism and semantics in job descriptions does not make it okay.

review_title: Not the best job I've ever had, not the worst job I've ever had
job_title: Secretary III in Little Rock, AR
pros: Great benefits, devoted staff, great mission, professional environment.
cons: I don't agree with (the new CEO) Marcy Doderer's plan to boost ACH's survey standings in US News and World Report.  Using a magazine survey as a benchmark seems short-sighted when there are children in this state who don't have access to food, dental and healthcare.

review_title: It's a job and it pays...

Friendly staff,

job_title: Registered Nurse in Little Rock, AR
pros: Wonderful team atmosphere.  Beautiful facility, state of the art technology at your fingertips. Management was very supportive and encouraging especially when it came to continuing education.  Many opportunities for growth and advancement within the hospital.
cons: The pay is competitive for the LIttle Rock market but compared nationwide it is lacking. Parking was an issue, you were required to pay to park in the parking garage or select spots around the facility.

review_title: the children are great...but other areas are lacking
job_title: Hospital Child Care in Little Rock, AR
pros:
Helping make a difference in children's lives
Decent wages and benefits
free parking
campus shuttle
Stable schedules
cons:
hospital and campus layout is confusing and forever changing
there is a waiting list to get your child in the on campus daycare
daycare is only available during day shifts and not night shifts
the daycare is disorganized..and children are changing classes constantly from room to room. They might stay with one teacher for only 3 months then move to another room.
Their playground equipment at the daycare is not stimulating enough and there is not enough toys for all the children.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Little Rock, AR
pros: Arkansas Childrens is a Magnet hospital. Professional development and involvement in decision making is strongly encouraged whether it be by being on committees or participating in research studies. They are constantly looking for new ways to be more efficient and produce better outcomes for patients, families, and staff. They provide good health benefits as well as contributions to 401ks etc.
cons: I have not experienced any aside from the occasional peer to peer disagreement which I believe happens to some degree any time you are a part of a large organization.

review_title: Great opprotunity with room to grow
job_title: Admissions Counsleor in Little Rock, AR
pros: I like working at Children's because it is a great place to start a career. The benefits package is very nice and my supervisor is very accomodating with time off requests, etc. I work in a small department and my coworker and I have the ability to work freely as needed.
cons: One of the only downsides to working here is the inclement weather policy. When the weather is bad, snow, ice or a combination, essentail employees are still required to be at work.

job_title: Patient Information Assistant in Little Rock, AR
pros: The best part of working at ACH is working with the children and their families. This is what makes this place great! The benefits are good also.
cons: Upper management needs to listen to their employees suggestions more often. It is difficult to take the time off one has accrued due to short staff situations in most departments

review_title: Best place to work?  Try asking those of us who actually work here!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Little Rock, AR
pros: Serving the patients and families
cons: Administration seems more interested in throwing parties for themselves than supporting front line staff.   I’ve been here a long time and it used to be about the patients but its all about the money now.  They raise all this money and yet somehow we can’t have more people.  It doesn’t seem like they know what they’re doing but that’s what happens when you get hired for who you know not what you can do.

job_title: Staff RN in Little Rock, AR

job_title: RN, Bsn in Little Rock, AR

It is a great place for a new graduate to get experience, but not to make a long term career choice.

review_title: This is an excellent place to work, especially if you are a programmer.  I worked there for 3 years.

review_title: Great company, low pay and expensive insurance
